thread.title: Tottenham slap €100m price tag on Alli
thread.title_full: Tottenham slap €100m price tag on Alli

author: Okogba
title: Tottenham slap €100m price tag on Alli
text:
Home » Sports » Tottenham slap €100m price tag on Alli Tottenham slap €100m price tag on Alli On 11:03 pm In Sports by Okogba Comments 
Tottenham are fully aware that they have a star in their ranks in Dele Alli and are not willing to let him leave the club unless an offer exceeding €100 million arrives for the 20-year-old. That price, however, might not be enough to repel the interest of Real Madrid and Bayern Munich – two teams said to be monitoring his progression. Tottenham Hotspur’s English midfielder Dele Alli (2nd L) jumps to score his and Totenham’s second goal with this header during the English Premier League football match between Tottenham Hotspur and Chelsea at White Hart Lane in London, on January 4, 2017. / AFP PHOTO 
The Times say that the fee that brought Gareth Bale to Real Madrid would have to be outdone in order to poach the player from Mauricio Pochettino’s side. They did not specify a price but Bale’s fee was in the region of €100 million. Alli signed a new five-year-deal with the club and also received a boost in his pay for his emergence as one of the best young players in European football. 
The same report, however, states that Tottenham do not want any of their star names to leave until they have played at least one year in their stadium, which they will move to for the start of the 2018-19 season. At the moment, Allie is on €69,000 per week and over €3 million a year as he contonues to grow in the Surs shirt; he has 13 goals this season in all competitions. Okogba
